plusCode.compoundCode: P2R4+Q2 Manhattan, New York, NY, USA

adrFormatAddress: 120 W 21st St, Manhattan, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: Very poorly managed garage. Waited for almost an hour to get our car. Only 1 person managing the whole area. It was very frustrating. I wouldn’t feel safe leaving the car here as during my wait, I saw how the cars were handled. I would never use this again and would not recommend this to anyone.

I wouldn’t feel safe leaving the car here as during my wait, I saw how the cars were handled. I would never use this again and would not recommend this to anyone.

originalText.text: Try to avoid this garage if you have oversize suv.  I have suburban and Paid extra $15 fee for oversize fee when I reserved but still make you pay extra $10 for no reason .you have no choice but paying them if you want your car back .  Never again this place

text.text: Try to avoid this garage if you have oversize suv.  I have suburban and Paid extra $15 fee for oversize fee when I reserved but still make you pay extra $10 for no reason .you have no choice but paying them if you want your car back .  Never again this place

originalText.text: The employees that work here are miserable and rude. We pull in to park and the parking attendant demands me to stop by putting his hand up annoyingly. We proceed to wait almost 10 minutes in the car until he finally waves us on. He then asks how long we will be and when I reply 6 hours he shakes his head back and with a disgusted look on his face. Who does that especially someone who works for tips? When we come back to get the car, another employee greets us in silence when I ask how he is and grunts when I say thank you after he pulls our car up. I thought it would be rude to stiff them (even though they deserved it), so I put a whole  $1 into the tip box. Maybe it's me but I would go out of my way to be courteous and somewhat pleasant when relying on gratuities.

originalText.text:
This garage is a scam.
I reserved and prepaid for a spot 10 days before on ParkWhiz and when I arrived, I was told they have zero spot. They claimed that ParkWhiz always "overbook" knowing that they don't have spots available. I knew it could not be true because they had 10 days to inform me the garage was already full, yet they didn't. When I called the customer service of ParkWhiz, I was informed this information is incorrect, there is no such thing as overbooking. This garage is supposed to honor the bookings made via ParkWhiz, it is part of the agreement. After wasting time and gas to get this garage, and spending another 10 minutes on the phone to resolve this situation, ParkWhiz was able to provide a refund and book me another garage nearby. The staff at this site just stood around, lied about the situation, and watched me put up with their poor customer service in amusement. They even had the nerve to tell me to have a great day in a sarcastic tone, knowing that they gave zero effort to assist me.

I have reasons to believe this garage is scamming its customers and parking apps they partner with by not honoring reservations. They cannot be trusted. Save your time and money. Go to a different garage.

originalText.text: The arrogant parking attendant was pulling out someone else’s car as I was attempting to pull in and didn’t see him when he was turning the corner inside I immediately stopped and I could tell he had an attitude from inside a customers car waving his hands at me to reverse. So as I was slowly reversing up a steep hill with tons of cars surrounding mine on the side.  he’s was driving so fast almost as if he was going to hit the front bumper of my car . I screamed at him at the top of my lungs to stop. Needless to say I reversed all the way out and would refuse to leave my car here as this person clearly does not care at all about the vehicles and should not be operating vehicles at all .this set up is dangerous and accident prone. Do yourself a favor and go to another parking garage
